title.narrative: Project for support to community resilience through the promotion of gardening and income generation

description.narrative:
Building community resilience through the promotion of gardening and income generation will increase the adaptive capacity of communities living in Zarmaganda located in Tillabéry region of Niger. Once the food basket of western Niger, today the region is characterized by low and poorly distributed rainfall leading to recurrent droughts and a gradual decline in productivity (300kg/ha for the millet the main food staple of the communities). Demographic pressure on the meagre resources makes the food security situation very difficult. The availability of food to sustain the basic needs of the population became precarious driven by alternating good and bad years of harvest and drought periods made unpredictable by the effects of climate change. Improving this precarious food insecurity while reducing poverty in these communities require actions to diversify income generating activities. The introduction and strengthening of market gardening is a promising high-potential ad-value activity which can contribute to improve food security and generate additional income for the targeted communities.
This pilot project of six months is designed to develop an integrated system for strengthening community resilience through the combination of activities including the introduction of a profitable agricultural system by remote controlled irrigation, market gardening, practical training, literacy and poultry.
